Lab 1A : Artemis

Prelab

For the Prelab, I frist installed the lastest version of Arduino 2.3.4 and then I installed the latest version of SparkFun Apollo3 2.2.1 which are necessary for the basis of the lab.

Task 1 : Run Blink

In task 1, afer hooking up the Artemis board up to my computer, I tested the board by running the Blink file in the Examples folder.

Task 2 : Serial

I uploaded Example4_Serial which allowed me to type in the serial monitor and have the Artemis board print out the characters I typed in.

Task 3 : AnalogRead

I ran Example2_analogRead to test the temperature sensor on the Artemis board; however, I did not quite understand the counts or what it implied. I replaced the temp_raw (counts) to temp_f which helped me understand that the Arthemis board was reading the temperature in Fahrenheit.

Task 4 : Microphone Output

I uploaded Example3_MicrophoneOutput, and I was able to test the microphone on the Artemis board. I played the chord tuner that I use for my ukulele, and I was able to see the output of the microphone (see the change in frequency) on the serial monitor.

Task 5 : Additional tasks for 5000-level students

For this task, I frist played the C note, and from there I got the frequency range for the note C. From there I wrote a simple if statement that would light the LED when a the frequency of the note played was within the range of the note C.

Discussion

I learned a lot from this lab. I faced many learning challenges given I haven't used Arduino IDE in quite a while. However, Lab 1A helped me get back into the groove of things. I learned how the format the code in the Arduino IDE, and I learned how to upload the code to the Artemis board.
